trans-unit.source: On-Premises SQL Linked Service
trans-unit.target: On-Premises SQL Linked Service

trans-unit.source: This topic provides the JSON format that is supported by the older versions of Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: This topic provides the JSON format that is supported by the older versions of Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: If you are using the July 2015 Release version of Azure PowerShell or later, see <link xlink:href="6d25308b-b9c3-414f-98d4-a1abd72e13ea" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">On-Premises SQL Server Linked Service</link> for the latest JSON format.
trans-unit.target: If you are using the July 2015 Release version of Azure PowerShell or later, see <link xlink:href="6d25308b-b9c3-414f-98d4-a1abd72e13ea" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">On-Premises SQL Server Linked Service</link> for the latest JSON format.

trans-unit.source: You can convert the JSON from old format to new format by using the tool: <externalLink><linkText>JSON Upgrade Tool</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=618507</linkUri></externalLink>
trans-unit.target: You can convert the JSON from old format to new format by using the tool: <externalLink><linkText>JSON Upgrade Tool</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=618507</linkUri></externalLink>

trans-unit.source: You create an On-premises SQL linked service to link an on-premises SQL Server database to an Azure data factory.
trans-unit.target: You create an On-premises SQL linked service to link an on-premises SQL Server database to an Azure data factory.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes syntax for defining an on-premises SQL Server linked service in a JSON file.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes syntax for defining an on-premises SQL Server linked service in a JSON file.

trans-unit.source: When you use the Data Factory Editor in Azure Portal, the editor provides you a JSON template for defining a linked service that you can modify and deploy to create a linked service.
trans-unit.target: When you use the Data Factory Editor in Azure Portal, the editor provides you a JSON template for defining a linked service that you can modify and deploy to create a linked service.

trans-unit.source: To use the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.Azure.Commands.DataFactories.New-AzureDataFactoryLinkedService</codeEntityReference> cmdlet to create a linked service, you will need to create a JSON file and use it with the cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: To use the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.Azure.Commands.DataFactories.New-AzureDataFactoryLinkedService</codeEntityReference> cmdlet to create a linked service, you will need to create a JSON file and use it with the cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: You must also install a Data Management Gateway on an on-premises computer either on the same machine that hosts the database or on a separate machine to avoid competing for resources with the database.
trans-unit.target: You must also install a Data Management Gateway on an on-premises computer either on the same machine that hosts the database or on a separate machine to avoid competing for resources with the database.

trans-unit.source: Data Management Gateway is a software that connects on-premises data sources to cloud services in a secure and managed way.
trans-unit.target: Data Management Gateway is a software that connects on-premises data sources to cloud services in a secure and managed way.

trans-unit.source: See <externalLink><linkText>Enable your pipelines to work with on-premises data</linkText><linkUri>https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/data-factory-use-onpremises-datasources/</linkUri></externalLink> for detail about Data Management Gateway.
trans-unit.target: See <externalLink><linkText>Enable your pipelines to work with on-premises data</linkText><linkUri>https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/data-factory-use-onpremises-datasources/</linkUri></externalLink> for detail about Data Management Gateway.

trans-unit.source: When creating a dataset based on this linked service, you set the location type in the dataset JSON to: <link xlink:href="5606aefb-b5d3-49f0-b108-2ab3d0652e77#OnPremSQL" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">OnPremisesSqlServerTableLocation</link>.
trans-unit.target: When creating a dataset based on this linked service, you set the location type in the dataset JSON to: <link xlink:href="5606aefb-b5d3-49f0-b108-2ab3d0652e77#OnPremSQL" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">OnPremisesSqlServerTableLocation</link>.

trans-unit.source: When creating a pipeline, you set the source type to <link xlink:href="34d563cf-1163-47e5-96b8-9c7aec5f37d2#SqlSource" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">SqlSource</link> if you are using an on-premises SQL Server database as a source in a copy operation.
trans-unit.target: When creating a pipeline, you set the source type to <link xlink:href="34d563cf-1163-47e5-96b8-9c7aec5f37d2#SqlSource" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">SqlSource</link> if you are using an on-premises SQL Server database as a source in a copy operation.

trans-unit.source: You set the sink type to <link xlink:href="34d563cf-1163-47e5-96b8-9c7aec5f37d2#SqlSink" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">SqlSink</link> if you are using an on-premises SQL Server database as a sink in the copy operation.
trans-unit.target: You set the sink type to <link xlink:href="34d563cf-1163-47e5-96b8-9c7aec5f37d2#SqlSink" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">SqlSink</link> if you are using an on-premises SQL Server database as a sink in the copy operation.

trans-unit.source: Properties
trans-unit.target: Properties

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: type
trans-unit.target: type

trans-unit.source: The type property should be set to: <embeddedLabel>OnPremisesSqlLinkedService</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The type property should be set to: <embeddedLabel>OnPremisesSqlLinkedService</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: connectionString
trans-unit.target: connectionString

trans-unit.source: Specify connectionString information needed to connect to the on-premises SQL Server database using either SQL authentication or Windows authentication.
trans-unit.target: Specify connectionString information needed to connect to the on-premises SQL Server database using either SQL authentication or Windows authentication.

trans-unit.source: gatewayName
trans-unit.target: gatewayName

trans-unit.source: Name of the gateway that the Data Factory service should use to connect to the on-premises SQL Server database.
trans-unit.target: Name of the gateway that the Data Factory service should use to connect to the on-premises SQL Server database.

trans-unit.source: username(optional)
trans-unit.target: username(optional)

trans-unit.source: Specify user name if you are using Windows Authentication.
trans-unit.target: Specify user name if you are using Windows Authentication.

trans-unit.source: password (optional)
trans-unit.target: password (optional)

trans-unit.source: Specify password for the user account you specified for the username.
trans-unit.target: Specify password for the user account you specified for the username.

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: JSON for using SQL Authentication:
trans-unit.target: JSON for using SQL Authentication:

trans-unit.source: JSON for using Windows Authentication:
trans-unit.target: JSON for using Windows Authentication:

trans-unit.source: If username and password are specified, gateway will use them to impersonate the specified user account to connect to the on-premises SQL Server database.
trans-unit.target: If username and password are specified, gateway will use them to impersonate the specified user account to connect to the on-premises SQL Server database.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, gateway will connect to the SQL Server directly with the security context of Gateway (its startup account).
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, gateway will connect to the SQL Server directly with the security context of Gateway (its startup account).
